title: Head of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
content:
At Flatiron Health, we recognize that as a global company, we cannot remove ourselves from the health inequities we see around the world, particularly in cancer care and research. Achieving our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experiences of every person with cancer, depends on our ability to attract, inspire and retain a diverse set of employees while cultivating an inclusive and equitable environment. 
We’re looking for a Head of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) to help us accomplish our mission to improve lives by learning from the experience of every cancer patient. Are you ready to be the next change maker in cancer care? 
What You'll Do
Reporting to the Chief People Officer, this role will be responsible for building upon our current Diversity, Equity and Inclusion strategy, with a focus on four key areas: building and sustaining a more diverse workforce; cultivating an inclusive and equitable environment; increasing accountability and awareness; and engaging with community and research partners to improve health equity. 
This position will also be responsible for driving results through partnership and collaboration across the company, including with senior leaders, People Team members and other functional and business teams. Some key responsibilities will include:
Building and sustaining a more diverse workforce

Keep a pulse on Flatiron business needs and partner with People Team COEs, HRBPs and business leaders to design company wide processes as well as function-specific DEI action plans for attracting, inspiring and developing talent based on quantitative & qualitative data
Assist in designing and launching programs focused on underrepresented groups that support the development and retention of diverse talent and leadership pipelines

Cultivating an inclusive and equitable environment

Oversee our Employee Resource Group (ERG) program, serving as the liaison between these groups and leadership, and partnering with ERG leads to inform how the broader Flatiron employee experience can incorporate their feedback
Collaborate with Legal & Employee Relations in matters related to DEI, including change management, investigations, and employment actions

Increasing accountability and awareness

Collaborate with People Team leaders to curate and leverage data across the employee journey to track and evaluate our efforts and develop recommendations to address future needs
Partner with Internal and External Communications teams to provide timely updates to key audiences (e.g., company-wide, leadership, managers, prospective candidates, other external audiences) on progress and opportunities

Engaging with community and research partners to improve health equity

Partner with the Head of Health Equity Research to advance integration of a health equity prioritization lens across Flatiron through targeted internal and external engagements

Who You Are
You're a collaborative problem-solver who values the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition, you're a results-oriented leader, with the ability to set clear goals to motivate employees, managers and key stakeholders, develop actionable plans, and manage work to achieve desired outcomes. You value receiving and providing candid feedback in order to provide measurable impact. You're excited by the prospect of tackling meaningful problems each and every day. 

You have 8-10 years of substantive work experience in one or more Human Resources functions 
You have at least 2 years of hands-on experience working on diversity, equity & inclusion initiatives with a track record of results (e.g. managed and responsible for DEI efforts in previous roles, served in a leadership role on a DEI working group/ERG)
You possess impressive expertise that instills confidence and demonstrates an understanding of key issues in the diversity, equity and inclusion space, as well as a desire to drive meaningful change in a pragmatic and action-oriented manner
You have excellent written and verbal communication, presentation and relationship-building skills across all levels of stakeholders in a highly cross-functional and collaborative environment, including demonstrating an ability to influence without authority
You are driven by a sense of accountability, including assuming ownership for achieving personal results and collective team goals
You have experience and proven ability to “roll up your sleeves” and prioritize as needed while handling multiple time-sensitive projects in a fast-paced environment
You have proven data analysis skills and the ability to synthesize and visualize key findings from large amounts of information to then leverage data driven decision making 
You are a systems thinker with demonstrated experience leading significant change processes effectively and efficiently both in the short-term and long-term for an outcome over time
You are comfortable to fail and experiment, conduct retrospectives and harness learnings to shape actions

Extra Credit 

You have people management experience

Where you’ll work 
In this hybrid role, you’ll have a defined work location that includes work from home and 2-3 office days set by you and your team with the option of being Flex or Office. For more information on our approach to hybrid work as well as our work type options, please visit the how we work website. 
Life at Flatiron 
At Flatiron Health, we offer a full range of benefits to support you and your loved ones so you can focus your working hours on improving cancer care and accelerating cancer research, and your non-working hours on everything else life has to offer: 

Work/life autonomy via flexible work hours and flexible paid time off
Comprehensive compensation package
401(k) contribution to help you reach your retirement planning goals
Financial health resources including 1:1 financial advice
Mental well-being tools and services 
Parental benefits and policies including family-building care and generous leave
Path to parenthood programs supporting fertility, adoption and surrogacy
Travel support for safe healthcare services
Lifestyle spending account for perks that make sense for you and your family

In addition to our robust benefit offerings, visit our Life at Flatiron page to learn how we support continuous learning through professional development programs and celebrate Diversity in the workplace.

demographic_questions.description:
At Flatiron, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected, and have an opportunity to succeed. From several Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to regular internal reporting on our D&I metrics to constantly investigating new ways to connect with underrepresented populations, we have embedded diversity into every corner of our hiring process and employee experience. As part of that, we encourage candidates to voluntarily complete the following survey which helps us keep track of how we’re doing in our efforts to achieve an equal seat at the table for everyone.

Information collected as part of this survey:

  • Is completely voluntary
  • Is anonymous and does not have any bearing on your application
  • Is measured in aggregate only (for use in anonymized reporting related to our DEI efforts).

questions.description:
Thank you for your interest in opportunities at Flatiron. When creating a profile and submitting your application, we will collect the following categories of personal information: direct identifiers, such as your name and contact information; professional information, such as your previous employment, education background, and work authorizations (e.g., work visas); and other information you include in your resume, cover letter and other job application materials, such as your preferences, skills, abilities, and references. We also may collect your social media information if you connect your social media account to your application. 

We use each category of the information you provide to evaluate your candidacy for the job opening(s) that you apply for and other job openings at Flatiron that we think may interest you. We may, in certain instances, transfer this data to third-party platforms so that we may better evaluate your candidacy (e.g., to compare your application to a broader candidate pool). We also use each category of information for other business purposes, including to comply with federal and state laws requiring us to maintain certain records, to manage our workforce, to detect security incidents, and to protect against fraudulent or other illegal activity.

For more information about how we use your information, please visit our Privacy Policy.
